Viewing the Audit Menu

The Audit menu is available on the main window only when the Audit component has been selected from the upper pane. Depending upon the privileges assigned to you and the activities you need to perform, some options may not be enabled. A check mark in front of a menu option indicates that the option has been selected.

Send To...

Send a copy of an audit entry to one or more team members via e-mail.

Print...

Print the data displayed in the upper pane for the selected audit entries.

Export

Export the data displayed in the upper pane for use in a spreadsheet, database, or other application.

Select

Select All: Select all audit entries displayed in the upper pane.

By Query: Select all audit entries displayed in the upper pane that match a particular query.

By Label:Select all audit entries displayed in the upper pane that have a particular label.

Expand All

Expand all groups of audit entries in the audit log.

Collapse All

Collapse all groups of audit entries in the audit log.

All Descendants

Displays all audit entries associated with the folder selected from the application folder hierarchy and all of its child folders. When this option is not selected, the upper pane displays only those audit entries associated with the selected folder.

Find...

Find all audit entries containing text that matches the specified text string.

Find Next

Find the next audit entry containing text that matches the specified text string.

Find Previous

Find the previous file containing text that matches the specified text string.

Filters

Show Fields...: Change the column headers that appear in the upper pane.

Sort and Group...: Sort and group the data in the upper pane based on up to four audit entry properties.

Queries...: Create or apply a query. Items that match the query become the rows displayed in the upper pane.

Save Current Settings...: Save the current column headers, query, and method of sorting and grouping as a filter, which can be reapplied in the future.

Reset Current Settings: Return to the current default filter as defined on the server.

Filters...: Display the filters available for this component. This option allows you to select a filter or create a new one. An asterisk preceding a filter name in the filter list box indicates that you have changed the contents of the upper pane since the filter was applied. For example, you may have displayed additional fields, grouped the items differently, or applied another query.

Reports...

Create a report using the selected audit entries.

Charts

Simple...: Create a simple chart. A simple chart contains only one series (one line, one row of bars, etc.).

Distribution...: Create a distribution chart. A distribution chart is the same as a pie chart. Each wedge indicates what fraction of the whole a group represents.

Correlation...: Create a correlation chart. A correlation chart shows the relationship or degree of relationship between numeric values in several series.

Time Series..: Create a time series chart. A time-series chart is a line chart that shows the number of items that have the same day, week, or month in the specified time/date field.
